lines.text: We all see what we want to see. Coffey looks and he sees Russians. He sees hate and fear. You have to look with better eyes than that.
When it comes to the safety of these people, there's me and then there's God, understand?
Keep your pantyhose on.
We don't need them. We can't trust them. We may have to take steps. We're gonna have to take steps.
Explorer, this is Cab Three, starting our descent along the umbilical.
Roger that, Cab Three. Good luck.
Luck is not a factor.
Hippy, you think everything is a conspiracy.
Everything is.
It went straight for the warhead, and they think it's cute.
What is all this stuff?
Fluid breathing system, we just got it. You use it when you go really deep.
How deep?
Deep.
*How* deep?
It's classified.
It's not easy being a cast-iron bitch. It takes discipline, and years of training... A lot of people don't appreciate that.
[to the aliens floating behind the water-curtain]
Howdy. Uh... How are you guys doin'?
[passing over the wreck of the Montana]
Coffey, these are the missile hatches, is that right?
That's right. It looks like a couple of hatches have sprung. Radiation's nominal. Warheads must still be intact.
How many are there?
Twenty-four Trident missiles, eight M.I.R.V.s per missile.

[after a pause]
That's a hundred and ninety-two warheads, Coffey. How powerful are they?
The M.I.R.V. is a tactical nuke. Uh, fifty kilotons, nominal yield, say... five times Hiroshima.
[One Night, listening, mouths "fuck!"]
Jesus Christ. It's World War Three in a can.
[Bud is being put into the fluid-breathing suit]
So, I can hear you, but I can't talk, right?
The fluid prevents the larynx from making sound. Excuse me. It'll feel a little strange.
Yeah, no shit.
[One Night is trying to disconnect the umbilical]
How's it going, One Night?
All hell must be breakin' loose up there. This cable's pissin' me off. I can't get a grip on it!
Well, keep tryin' baby, just keep tryin'.

[back on the Benthic]
Shit! We've got a problem! We're losing number two thruster! Bearing's going... It's not holding! We're swinging out of position here!
God damn it!
[the cable slams into One Night's cab]
Shit!
The rig is movin'!
Yeah, I can see that!
[to the radio]
Topside! Topside, pay out some slack, we're gettin' dragged!

[to the crane operator over radio]
Down on number one winch!
We're gettin' dragged!

[shouts]
Down on one!
[he gestures frantically through the window at the crane operator; the crane operator signals that he can't hear; the crane breaks off the ship and falls into the water]
Shit! Get him on the UQC!
[into the radio]
Bud! We lost the crane!
Say again, what?
The crane! We've lost the crane! It's on its way down to you!
All right, all right everybody brace for impact! Close all the exterior hatches, let's go go go go!

[to SEALs]
You two help secure the rig! Let's go!
One Night! One Night, can you hear me? Get the hell outta there, the crane's comin' down!
[part of the cable hits One Night's cab, but she manages to get away]
I'm okay, I'm clear, Bud!
[the crew braces for impact; Hippy puts Beany in a plastic bag]
Bud, give me a reading from your liquid oxygen gauge.

[typing]
5 minuts worth

[whispers, shocked]
What?

[panicked]
It took him *thirty* minutes just to get down there!
Bud! Do you hear me? You drop your weights and start back now, Bud. The gauge could be wrong! Do you hear me? Just drop your weights and start back now! Your gauge could be wrong!
[crying]
Your gauge could be wrong, you drop your weights and start back now!

[typing]
Going to stay awhile

No, you won't stay there, do you hear me, you drop your weights! You can breathe *shallow*, do you hear me? Bud, please listen to me, *please*, goddammit, you dragged me back from the bottomless pit, you can't leave me here *alone* now, please...
[sobs]
Oh god, Virgil, *please*... please...

[typing]
Dont cry baby. Knew this was one way ticket, but you know I had to come. Love you wife.
Virgil, you wiener.
It says... It says, uh... "Virgil Brigman back on the air".
We should be dead. We didn't decompress.
They musta done something to us.

[smiling]
Yeah. Yeah, I think you could say that.
[Is sleeping and snoring loudly]
Turn on your side, Virgil.
[Does so, still asleep, and stops snoring]
[the Deep Core crew are locked in the kitchen; Coffey is about to nuke the aliens]
Schoenick, your Lieutenant's about to make a real bad career move!
The guy's crazier than a shit-house rat!
Schoenick!
They're trying to make contact! Schoenick, *please*, listen to us!
Can't you see he's lost it?
Shut up.
The shock wave will kill us.
Quiet!

[relentlessly]
It'll crush this rig like a beer can.
Shut up man, what're you talkin' about?
We've gotta stop him!
Shut up!
This is not our mission! We can't detonate without orders!
Goddammit, you bitch! You never backed away from anything in your life! Now fight!
[slaps Lindsey]
Fight!
[slaps Lindsey again]
Fight! Right now! Do it! Fight goddammit! Fight! Fight! Fiiiiight!

[regarding Lindsey Brigman]
God, I hate that bitch.
Probably shouldn't have married her then, huh?
Oh no, look who's with them. Queen Bitch of the Universe.
[Ensign Monk is demonstrating the breathing fluid on Hippy's rat]
Huh. Damn rat's breathing that shit. That is no bullshit, hands down. The Goddamnedest thing I ever saw.
Linds, I want you to stay away from that guy. I mean it.
The guy is gone. Did you see his hands?
What? He got the shakes?

Look, he's operating on his own. He's cut off from his chain of command. He's showing signs of pressure-induced psychosis, and he's got a nuclear weapon. So as a personal favor to me, will you try to put your tongue in neutral for a while?

[nervous]
I got to tell you, I give this whole thing a sphincter-factor of about nine point five.

[looking at the picture Lindsey took of the alien craft]
That's a great shot, Linds.
You drop your dive light?
No, come on you guys, come on. Now that's the small one, that's the small one here. You can kinda see how it's zigging around.
Yeah, whatever it is.
I'm *telling* you what it is, you're just not *hearing* me.
Now Lindsey, you...
There is something down there! Something not us.
You could be more specific.

[humorously]
Somethin' that "zigs".
Not *us*. Not *human*, get it? Something non-human, but intelligent... A non-terrestrial intelligence.
A non-terrestrial intelligence. NTIs. Oh man, that's better than UFOs. Oh, but that works too, huh? "Underwater Flying Objects".
So raise your hand if you think that was a Russian water-tentacle.
Everybody just stay calm. The situation is under control.
These guys are SEALS?
Eh. These guys ain't so tough. I fought guys plenty tougher'n them.
Now we get to hear how you "coulda been a contender"?
[Lindsay sees the nuclear warhead]
You know, you've got some huevos bringin' that thing into my rig. With all that's going on up in the world you bring a nuclear weapon IN HERE?
Mrs. Brigman...
Does this strike anyone as particularly psychotic, or is it just me?
Mrs. Brigman, you don't need to know the details of our operation, it's better if you don't.
You're right, I don't need to know, what I need to know is that THING is off this rig, do you hear me ROGER RAMJET?
Bud, did you know your hand is blue?
Finler, why don't you just shut up and put your gear on?
You know, we got Russian subs creepin' around; anythin' goes wrong they can say whatever they want happened! Give their folks medals!
Relax, will ya? You're makin' the women nervous.
Cute, Virgil.
I need you to believe me right now. Please?
You know, I can't believe you were dumb enough to come down here. Now you're stuck here for the storm. That was dumb, hot rod. Real dumb.
I didn't come down here to fight with you.
Yeah? Well, why did you come down then?

You need me. Nobody knows the systems on this rig better than I do. Once you're disconnected from the Explorer you are on your own for however long this storm lasts. I mean, what if something was to happen after the surface deport clears off? What would you have done?
Yeah, right. Us poor, dumb old boys would've had to think for ourselves. Coulda been a disaster!
This tell us how much radiation we're getting?
Whoa. Whoa. Whoa. I'm not going near no radiation. No way.
Aw Hippy, you pussy.
Yeah, what good is the money, six months later your dick drops off?
[the cab is flooding]
All right, all right, here.
[takes off his dive suit collar]
You put this on.
No, no! What are you doing?
Don't argue with me, goddammit, just put it on!
Look, this is not an option, so just forget about it, all right?
Lindsey, shut up! Shut up, and put this thing on!
If you'll be logical for one second...
FUCK LOGIC!
Please, listen! Just listen to me for one second. Now you've got the suit on, and you're a much better swimmer than I am, right?

[reluctantly]
Yeah, maybe...
Right? Yes! So I've got a plan.
What's the plan?
I drown, and you tow me back to the rig.
No. No!
Yes! This water...
NO!
...is only a couple degrees above freezing! I g-go into deep hypothermia, my blood'll go like ice water, right? My body systems will slow down, they won't stop...
Linds...
You tow me back and I can, I can be revived after, maybe ten or fifteen minutes. Ten-fifteen minutes!

[pushing the suit collar at her]
Linds, you put this on, you put it on!

[pushing the collar back at him]
No, it's the only way! Just put this on! Put this on, you know I'm right. Please, it's the only way, you've got all the s-stuff on the rig to do this! Put this on, Bud, *please*...

[putting the collar back on]
This is insane.
Oh my God, I know. But it's the only way.

I know how alone you feel... alone in all that cold blackness... but I'm there in the dark with you. Oh Bud you're not alone... Oh, God. You remember that time - you were pretty drunk, you probably don't remember - but the power went out in that little apartment we had on Orange Street? We were staring at that one little candle, and I, I said something really dumb like, that candle was me, and like every one of us is out there alone in the dark in this life... and you just, you just lit up another candle and you put it beside mine and said "No! See, that's me. That's me"... and we stared at the two candles, and then... well, if you remember any of this, I'm sure you remember the next part. But there *are* two candles in the dark. I'm with you. I'll always be with you Bud, I promise that.
Sniff something? Did ya, rat boy?
[after Cab 3 has landed in the water]
Hang on, gentleman. Touchdown. Crowd goes wild.
[about the rig]
I got over four years invested in this project.
Yeah, you only had three years invested in me.
Well you have to have priorities.
[after hearing they get three times diver's pay to check out the nuclear sub]
Hell, for triple time, I'd eat Beany!
Set me on fire and put me out with horse piss.
[showing the nuclear warhead to Bud on video]
Heeeeeeeeeeeeeere's M.I.R.V.!
[first lines]
Sixty knots? No way, Barnes. The Reds don't have anything that fast.
[last lines]
Hi, Brigman.
Hi, Mrs. Brigman.
Bud, give me a reading from your liquid oxygen gauge.

[typing]
5 minuts worth

[shocked]
What?
It took him *thirty* minutes just to get down there!

Bud! Do you hear me? You drop your weights and start back now, Bud. The gauge could be wrong. Do you hear me? Just drop your weights and start back now. The gauge could be wrong! The gauge could be wrong, you drop your weights and start back now!

[typing]
Going to stay awhile

No, you won't stay there, do you hear me, you drop your weights! You can breathe *shallow*, do you hear me? Bud, please listen to me, *please*, goddammit, you dragged me back from the bottomless pit, you can't leave me here *alone* now, please...
[sobs]
Oh God, Virgil, please... please...

[typing]
Don't cry baby. Knew this was one way ticket, but you know I had to come. Love you wife.

[over the phone]
Brigman here. Yeah, Kirkhill, what's going on? Yeah, I'm calm. I'm a calm person. Is there some reason I shouldn't be calm?
[long pause, then... ]

[furious]
WHAT?

[as the Pseudopod approaches]
Bud! Bud! Get up!
[Bud sits up, stares at the pseudopod]

[throwing a pillow at Cat]
Hey, Cat. Cat!

[half-awake]
Hey, lemme alone.
[sees the pseudopod, jerks awake and grabs a flowerpot as if to throw it]
The bad news is we got eight hours in this can blowin' down... And the worse news is, it's gonna take us three weeks to decompress later.
It's a bottomless pit, baby. Two-and-a-half miles straight down.

[about Lindsey]
She didn't leave me. She just left me behind.

I saw these things. I touched one of them. And... It wasn't some clunky steel can... like we would build. It glided. It was the most beautiful thing I've ever seen. Oh, God, I wish you'd been there. It was a machine. It was a machine, but it was alive. It was like a... like a dance of light. Please. You have to trust me. Now, I don't think they mean us any harm. I don't know how I know that. It's just... a feeling.
Let's get something straight. You people are under my authority.
Look, partner, we don't work for you. We don't take orders from you. And we don't much like you.
Hey, Cat. Cat.
Yeah?
Why don't you take the first watch on sonar? Okay?

[to Hippy]
I know, but we could get lucky, right? So we should go for it.

[the pseudopod mimics Lindsey]
It's trying to communicate.
[the pseudopod changes to Bud's face]
It's Bud!

[laughing delightedly]
It's wonderful!

[grinning]
It's me!
We have no way of warning the surface. And you know what that means? It means, whatever happens, is up to us.

[to the Alien]
How do you know they're really gonna do it? Where do you get off passing judgment on us? You can't be sure. How do you know?
[the aliens show him gruesome footage of war and conflict; Bud bows his head]

Well, hell, son. You better get a line down to us. We're in moderately poor shape down here. We've lost seven people, including Bud. And we're about out of O2, so whatever you're gonna do, you better do it fast.

[after the aliens call off the tidal wave that would have wiped out humanity]
You could've done it. Why didn't you?

[via the water screen, in Bud's typing]
Knew this was one way ticket, but you know I had to come. Love you wife.

[relaying what Bud types]
Have some new friends down here. Guess they've been here awhile. They've left us alone, but it bothers them to see us hurting each other. Getting out of hand. They sent a message. Hope you got it.
I'd say that's a big ten-four, Jack.
They want us to grow up a bit, and put away childish things. Of course, it's just a suggestion.
[laughter]
So, raise your hand if you thought that was a Russian water tentacle.
[entering Deep Core, Lindsey runs into Jammer]
Whoa! I don't remember someone putting a wall here.

[Holding up his fist]
You see this? They used to call this The Hammer.

[about the Navy SEALS]
These guys are about as much fun as a tax audit.
When you're hanging on by your fingernails, you can't go waving your arms around.
